summary: move features globalinit tasks to policyengine.afterstart
description: the and globalinit functions initializes infrastructure such as the droolspdpintegritymonitor before the topic endpoints and controllers are up
this has the potential of causing issues in the future if a dependency ever exists on those infrastructure elements
to avoid any issue the initialization code should be moved to then you can remove the dependency on and remove the policysessionfeatureapi implementation

care should be taken to assign sequence numbers so that the correct order of initialization is maintained between the and note that an instance of policyengine is required on the call to in the junit implementation this can be accomplished by either creating a dummy policyengine instance or passing policyengine.manager to the method
see junits for example

summary: addition of feature
description: add management which controls the state of the drools pdp it monitors states and controls of both within and across sites
this provides the controls which allows persisted policy transactions to be assumed by a drools pdp whose standby state has been promted to providing service
this depends on an state management system

summary: addition of state-management feature
description: add state management capabilities to the drools pdp
this provides the state management for the managment

summary: addition of policy-persistence feature
description: this adds a feature for policy-persistence which persists the state of drools pdp transactions and makes that state available across all drools pdp
this allows the transactions which were being served by a drools pdp which has failed to be assumed by another drools pdp which is designated as active by the management feature

summary: onap using oom kubernetes
description: title using oom kubernetes address full name michael company amdocs biography characters maximum the talk type presentation panel discussion hands on presentation for your proposal onap using oom kubernetes abstract character maximum development at onap occurs on the master branch
the onap project is therefore in need of an automated integration sanity to declare a particular tagged build sane and working at some defined level of functionality
this tagged build would represent a snapshot of artifacts and docker images usually a nightly or commit triggered tag

automatically determining the status of the master branch can be accomplished by running a continuous deployment framework after ci finishes and builds the artifacts in response to a git merge trigger callback

this presentation will go over a particular implementation of a short regression test as opposed to a full long regression that exercises an extended health check and the automated subset of the vfirewall use case demo to mark a particular tagged build as good

developers can then consume the and update their environments with only builds marked as ok a tbd this cd job can also verify that a commit did not break integration with other components as much as the sanity can provide maximum spanning coverage for
the presentation will run from triggered jenkins jobs that deploy for example an amazon aws spot vm deploy oom run health and the vfirewall collect and tear down the temporary vm
the process from the jenkins artifact creation trigger to vm teardown is between min per trigger depending on docker image preload
a combination of several and parallel live/background demos will compress the actual time to demonstrate onap cd in several passes
northbound clients like the opnfv auto project and cncf can also mark builds as ready to work with by subscribing to the cd result stream

in summary automatically deploy onap oom based on git submission artifact generation run extended healthcheck and automated parts of vfirewall sanity use case report back on whether specific tag code artifacts docker image repos is sane and ready for developer and northbound cncf opnfv consumption by default tear down oom deployment after testing or keep a rolling set up for testing or provide saved tagged ami for later reproduction the cd deploy will depending on load test or more merges per cd job see redeploy sh script on deployment integration jenkins job using to validate branch rotating live deployments in a public lab on aws feeds directly into the development process could show benefits vs docker compose/vagrant cncf crosscloud integration with onap discuss opnfv northbound client integration with onap discuss results of opnfv plugfest week before our see prototype on see tracking wiki at see tracking jira at recommended prerequisites an introduction to the onap operations manager oom deploy on any environment recommended follow up presentations for developers

summary: security vulnerabilities
description: following vulnerabilities are identified in clm scan
evaluation of the risk not impacted provide justification on each on why the vulnerability wont apply if impacted try to the dependencies if work around exist

or upgrade version as recommended last column if dependency cannot be removed for dublin ex jackson no version available please identify them and provide a plan on how this could be resolved in future

hibernate-validator validator before final and it was found that when the security manager's reflective permissions which allows it to access the private members of the class are granted to hibernate validator a potential privilege escalation can occur

by allowing the calling code to access those private members without the permission an attacker may be able to validate an invalid instance and access the private member value via to application is vulnerable by using this component when default typing is enabled and passing in untrusted data to be deserialized

note spring security has provided their own fix for this vulnerability if this component is being used as part of spring security then you are not vulnerable if you are running spring security or greater for or spring security or greater for request exception if cannot be addressed in time for dublin will need to be handled for e release
is vulnerable to remote code execution the validatesubtype function in the subtypevalidator class allows untrusted java objects to be deserialized
a remote attacker can exploit this by uploading a malicious serialized object that will result in rce if the application attempts to deserialize it
workaround do not use the default typing
instead you will need to implement your request exception if cannot be addressed in time for dublin will need to be handled for e release
application is vulnerable by using this component when default typing is enabled and passing in untrusted data to be deserialization
workaround do not use the default typing
instead you will need to implement your request exception if cannot be addressed in time for dublin will need to be handled for e release
fasterxml package contains a denial of service dos vulnerability
the deserialize method in the durationdeserializer class and the fromdecimal method in the instantdeserializer class allow arbitrarily large bigdecimal initialization values

a remote attacker can exploit this vulnerability by crafting and submitting a request that causes the application to deserialize an inordinately large value causing the application to hang and leading to a dos situation

the application is vulnerable by using the durationdeserializer or instantdeserializer classes of this component to deserialize untrusted request exception if cannot be addressed in time for dublin will need to be handled for e release

apparently this condition was not picked up by healthchecks
we are trying to do a workaround by restarting aaf pods but presumably this kind of corrective action should be automated by kubernetes assuming it detects the service is down

summary: provide a jetty server level solution to secure all servlets on a jetty instance
description: securing third party web services in opendaylight with servlet filters requires modifying third party jars to add the aaf cadifilter to servlet instances in web.xml files
supplying modified third party jar files in linux foundation onap is not an optimal solution and is likely to be rejected by the community
the base infrastructure of some onap components including appc and many sdc components is opendaylight which uses paxweb to manage the web services in the osgi container
paxweb simplifies the deployment of web services in an osgi container while isolating the services from each other
is an instance of a jetty server that can be configured through a jetty.xml or paxweb fragment bundle

paxweb isolates the web services on a per bundle basis with a webcontext and servlethandler connected to the main jetty server resulting in difficulty adding security filters to third party web services such as restconf and apidoc
due to this it is difficult to dynamically inject filters into existing osgi web services as it is not possible to access the webcontext or servlethandler outside of the web service bundle
current implementations of filters require modified versions of the web.xml in third party jars to add the cadifilter and aaf permissions filters to the servlet

paxweb allows customization of the jetty server at startup by providing a an aaf security handling solution that can be added to a jetty.xml will allow third party servlets to be secured through aaf without the need to modify the associated components
permission mapping should allow for customization based on request urls without server and port configured in a configuration file
default permission example namspace from configuration file url configuration example required optional solution should be compatible with open daylight nitrogen karaf pax web jetty
